Package com.amonson.prop_store

Class PropStoreFactory

java.lang.Object
com.amonson.prop_store.PropStoreFactory
public final class PropStoreFactory extends Object
Static class to register and create PropStore derived implementations for property serialization.

  • Method Details

    • getStore

      public static PropStore getStore(String name) throws PropStoreFactoryException
      Retrieve an instance of the named implementation.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the implementation to create.
      Returns:
      THe new instance of the PropStore derived class.
      Throws:
      PropStoreFactoryException - is thrown when the instance cannot be created or the name is not registered.

    • getStore

      public static PropStore getStore(String name, Properties args) throws PropStoreFactoryException
      Retrieve an instance of the named implementation with implementaion specific arguments..
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the implementation to create.
      args - The arguments in a map for the implementation, null is allowed.
      Returns:
      THe new instance of the PropStore derived class.
      Throws:
      PropStoreFactoryException - is thrown when the instance cannot be created or the name is not registered.

    • registerNewStore

      public static boolean registerNewStore(String name, Class<? extends PropStore> classObject) throws PropStoreFactoryException
      Used to add user parsers/generators derived from PropStore.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the parser to use. Cannot already exist in registry. Cannot be null.
      classObject - The class implementation derived from PropStore. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      True if the implementation was added to the registry. False if the 'name' already exists.
      Throws:
      PropStoreFactoryException - When the implementation cannot be added because of a missing ctor. The ctor for a PropStore derived class should take a java.util.Properties object.

    • getNames

      public static Collection<String> getNames()
      Gets the list of implementations supported.
      Returns:
      The collection of names supported by the factory.
